intro: Lasthenia hirsutula, commonly known as the hairy leaf everlasting, is a flowering plant native to California and parts of Nevada. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in spring, and its leaves are covered in fine, hairy structures. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
